citation.article-title: Haladaptatus paucihalophilus gen. nov., sp. nov., a halophilic archaeon isolated from a low-salt, sulfide-rich spring
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Haladaptatus (Hal.a.dap.ta′tus. Gr. n. hals salt; L. part. adj. adaptatus adapted to a thing; N.L. masc. n. Haladaptatus a bacterium adapted to salt).
Gram-negative cocci or coccobacilli occurring singly or in pairs.
Possess at least two heterogeneous 16S rRNA gene sequences.
Cells contain PG, PGP-Me and PGS.
Chemo-organotrophic, growing on a wide range of substrates, including single and complex carbon sources.
Hydrolyse starch, gelatin, casein and Tween 80.
Grow in a wide range of NaCl concentrations.
Sensitive to novobiocin, bacitracin, anisomycin and aphidicolin.
Partially sensitive to rifampicin and trimethoprim.
Resistant to erythromycin, penicillin, ampicillin, chloramphenicol, neomycin, nalidixic acid and gentamicin.
Survive at low salt concentrations and can recover after prolonged exposure to less than 0.2 M NaCl.
The type species is Haladaptatus paucihalophilus.
